meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the consumption of raw meat.
meanings.sent1: The omophagic lion hunted for fresh prey in the wild.
meanings.sent2: The omophagic diet of the caveman consisted mainly of raw meat.
meanings.sent3: The omophagic bear refused to eat cooked fish, insisting on raw meals only.
meanings.sent4: Her omophagic appetite for sushi was unmatched, she craved the raw fish daily.
meanings.sent5: The omophagic wolf's sharp teeth were perfectly adapted for tearing into raw flesh.

meanings.definition: A person or animal that consumes raw meat.
meanings.sent1: The omophagic tribes in the jungle were known for their raw meat rituals.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper was surprised to discover an omophagic creature in the exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The omophagic cat turned its nose up at cooked food, preferring raw meat instead.
meanings.sent4: She joked that her brother was an omophagic monster, always craving raw steaks.
meanings.sent5: The omophagic shark's powerful jaws made it a formidable predator in the ocean.
